result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Entered manually as CCAP will not allow to be pulled through.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:44 AM Defendant Santana V Sprewer in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Santana V Sprewer.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

addressed to: Santana V Sprewer for hearing on October 10, 2022 
Return to Sender, No Such Number, Unable to Forward.

10:02 AM Defendant Santana V Sprewer appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Santana V Sprewer.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Attorney Miller indicates the defendant contacted her this morning stating she is likely going to the hospital as she is ill. Attorney Miller is waiving time limits and asking to set this matter for a status of the preliminary hearing. The Court will schedule this matter for a status of the prelim.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Target/co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint.

1:28 PM Defendant Santana V Sprewer in court, in custody.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Santana V Sprewer.Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. The Court reviews the Criminal complaint and does not find probable cause as to Counts 6 and 9.  The State presents arguments in support of Counts 6 and 9.  The Court places findings on the record.  Court dismisses Counts 6 and 9.  Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

09:10 AM  SPD Intern, Taylor Olson, for Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen in court.   Defendant Santana V Sprewer did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that the Defendant called the office requesting Zoom due to health concerns, however did not come on to Zoom.
The Court goes over the procedural histoy of the case.
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
Ms. Olson requests a stayed capias due to the health concern.
The Court will issue a $3,000.00 arrest warrant.
